item.title: Talk about good timing! Online gallery features photos snapped at JUST the right moment with hilarious - and occasionally confusing - results
item.description: A series of hilarious pictures shared online have shown just what happens when people take a snap at the exact right moment in a gallery uploaded to Bored Panda
item.content:encoded:
So the saying goes, timing is everything and these pictures taken exactly at the right moment certainly prove that to be the case.

A mind-boggling new gallery compiled by Bored Panda showcases a bizarre range of optical illusions created by complete coincidence.

One photo sees a seemingly friendly dog turn into a sharp-toothed predator as the fence behind him becomes part of his profile. 

Another hilarious image sees an unsuspecting patient turn into a Mickey Mouse lookalike as he sits in front of a contraption which appears to give him a pair of ears.

We take a look at the weirdest images on the web... and it may take you a while to unravel them.
item.dc:abstract: A series of hilarious pictures shared online have shown just what happens when people take a snap at the exact right moment in a gallery uploaded to Bored Panda. (Clockwise: a dog which appears to have fangs, a man resembling Mickey Mouse, a van which appears to have hair, a dog with an invisible body, a couple with extra arms and legs, a cyclist who appears to be giving a man a piggy back)

item.title: Are things STILL going great? Friends co-creator reveals whether Ross and Rachel would be together today, ten years after the show wrapped - as he insists there will NEVER be a reunion
item.description: David Crane, who co-created the series with Marta Kauffman, spoke on a TV panel this week. He said Ross and Rachel would still be together today.
item.content:encoded:
For Friends superfans, there's good news, and there's bad news.

Speaking on a panel for The Wrap's Emmy series this week, one of the show's creators, David Crane, 60, spoke about the fate of beloved couple Ross and Rachel after the series wrapped in 2004.

Without even having to think about it, Crane revealed that the lovebirds would most certainly still be together if the show picked up again today — but fans shouldn't get their hopes up for any sort of reunion.

During the panel Crazy Ex-Girlfriend star Rachel Bloom asked Crane the big question: 'In your opinion, Ross and Rachel — doesn't have to be canon — how they doing? 

'Are they still together? Do you think that's sustainable?'

Ross and Rachel had dated off and on throughout the show, and went on to have a daughter named Emma. Some of the major drama of the series finale hinged on whether the couple would end up together — which they did.

And Crane promised that they'd still be together today, despite some of their struggles.

'Yes. Come on, they worked really hard, ten years,' he said. Crane added that Chandler and Monica are 'absolutely' still together too.

He wouldn't, however, say where he thought Ross and Rachel's daughter Emma might be going to college. 

But despite offering a much-desired look into the present-day lives of the characters, Crane — who created and ran the show with Marta Kauffman — said that fans won't ever get a chance to see that play out.

Despite shows like Full House, Will & Grace, Boy Meets World, and Roseanne getting reboots with the original characters, Crane said there's no such future for Friends.

Answering a question about a possible revival, he replied emphatically: 'Never happening. Never. We did it! It’s done. That’s why you don’t want to see more of it, because it’s all a happy ending .'

Crane's answers seem to but rumors to rest once and for all, even when members of the cast have kept them alive.

In 2017, Jennifer Aniston answered Ellen DeGeneres questions about a reunion by saying, 'Anything is a possibility, Ellen. Anything, right? I mean, George Clooney got married.' 

Lisa Kudrow, however, also isn't a fan of the idea of bringing the show back, telling Conan O'Brien this year: 'They’re rebooting everything. But I don’t know — how does that work with Friends, though? 

'That was about people in their 20s, 30s. The show isn’t about people in their 40s, 50s. And if we have the same problems, then that’s just sad. That’s not fun.'
item.dc:abstract: David Crane, 60, who co-created the series with Marta Kauffman, spoke on a TV panel this week. He revealed that Ross and Rachel would definitely still be together today, having worked 'really hard' on their relationship for ten years. Chandler and Monica would still be together, too. But he added that a reunion or reboot is n'ever happening' and the happy ending ensured that people wouldn't need one.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: Don't worry, guys: Ross and Rachel are still together

item.title: Star quality runs in the family! Glamorous lifestyle of Daniel Craig's VERY photogenic actress daughter, 25, revealed as he prepares to become a father again at 50 (and she calls herself his 'little nightmare')
item.description: Ella Loudon, 25, who lives in the US, is starting to carve out an acting career of her own, appearing in stage productions for Shakespeare & Company. She regularly shares snaps on Instagram.
item.content:encoded:
Daniel Craig may be one of the most famous men in the world - but his daughter Ella Loudon has largely remained out of the limelight. 

But now, Ella, 25, is starting to carve out an acting career of her own, appearing in stage productions for Shakespeare & Company. 

She has also starred in a new short film entitled Maneater - which tells the story of a young woman navigating the modern dating world. 

Ella - who is the eldest child of Craig and his first wife Fiona Loudon - regularly shares glamorous snaps on her Instagram account, along with candid pictures of her with her family - including one post in which she describes herself as her father's 'little nightmare'.

It comes as Craig, 50, and his second wife Rachel Weisz, 48, revealed earlier this year that they are expecting their first child together.

Scroll down for video  

Ella, who is extremely photogenic, regularly gives fans an insight into her enviable lifestyle on Instagram.

She also frequently shares candid snaps on her page, including a black-and-white selfie of her and her father on his 50th birthday in March.

Captioning the snap, she wrote: 'It’s my Pops 50th. Bloody proud and and love you always and forever. 

'Happy f****** birthday. Love from your little nightmare.'  

She also recently shared an intimate snap of her family, including her father, watching a rugby match together at home. 

Ella was one of only four people present when her father tied the knot with Rachel in a secret ceremony in New York back in 2011. 

Craig was married to Ella's mother Fiona, also an actress, for two years from 1992 to 1994. 

Ella clearly enjoys a close relationship with step-mother Rachel, recently sharing a post about the actress being the honoree of a film festival in Massachusetts.

She has also previously described how she often goes vintage shopping with both her mother and her step-mother, Rachel, showing their bond.  

Ella grew up in London, before moving to a boarding school in Massachusetts at the age of 17.

She then went on to study acting and theatre at NYU, but dropped out after a year. 

The actress has admitted in a previous interview how she suffered from depression, explaining how 'her head wasn't in the right place at the time'. 

Ella, who is also an artist, now lives between New York and LA, and has starred in a number of theatre productions.

She has shared a number of backstage shots from recent theatre productions with Shakespeare & Company, including Cymbeline.

The actress is also starring on stage in a new production of Macbeth with the company in Massachusetts.
item.dc:abstract: Ella Loudon, 25, (left, backstage at a play) who lives in the US, is starting to carve out an acting career of her own, appearing in stage productions for Shakespeare & Company. Ella, who is the eldest child of Craig and his first wife Fiona Loudon, regularly gives fans an insight into her lifestyle on Instagram. She also frequently shares candid snaps (right) on her page, including a black-and-white selfie of her and her father (bottom) on his 50th birthday in March. Craig, 50, and his second wife Rachel Weisz, 48, (top, in April) are expecting their first child together.

item.title: Student with chronic insomnia who needed EIGHT coffees a day to stay awake reveals how a 'magic' natural supplement costing £9.99 finally helped her sleep through the night
item.description: Parie Joshi, 21, from Liverpool had six hours of broken hours a sleep and would wake up almost hourly for 20 minutes at a time, leaving her too exhausted to function the next day.
item.content:encoded:
A student whose chronic insomnia made her resort to drinking eight cups of coffee a day to stay awake has revealed how she finally managed to beat her sleep disturbances. 

Parie Joshi, 21, from Liverpool had six hours of broken hours a sleep and would wake up almost hourly for 20 minutes at a time. 

Her poor sleep made her so lethargic the next day that every task from catching up with friends to attending lectures was a struggle and she began to fear she wouldn't be able to pursue her chosen career as a teacher. 

On the advice of her GP she tried everything from pillow sprays to pills, but nothing worked and she felt the issue start to 'dominate' her whole life.  

But after doing some research online, she discovered a natural supplement,  Benenox Overnight Recharge, £9.99, and is now able to finally sleep through the night thanks to the potion, which she describes as 'magic'. 

'A typical night’s sleep would start with continual scrolling on my phone to try and switch off but to no avail,' Parie said. 

'The struggle of getting to sleep was only the beginning of the problem; once finally asleep, I would wake up three to four times during the night, and be awake for about 20 minutes at a time. I had such a disturbed sleep pattern.'

The next morning, Parie would snooze her alarm at least four times before pulling herself out of bed.  

'My day would start with a cup of coffee, although this would usually be the first one of eight,' she recalled. 

'Even then, I’d struggle with terrible fatigue almost every day, lacking in energy and motivation whilst struggling with lethargy for even the simplest of tasks like taking the time to eat well, catch up with friends and attending lectures.'

After suffering with bad sleep for a year, Parie said it started to take over her life. 

'To cope with my fatigue, I would rely on caffeine and sugar to get my through the day, which would mean I would often crash at 4pm each day.

'I was concerned that my extreme tiredness would impact my studies and career as I struggled with lectures and in having the energy to complete assignments, hampering my potential.'

Parie sought medical advice for her condition, which she felt was caused by stress, but it didn't help.  

'I visited the doctor numerous times, had multiple blood tests, tried almost all the sleep aids from lavender sprays to medication, but still there was no explanation or cure for my poor sleep and energy levels.'

She decided to do her own research online and in November 2017 she discovered Benenox Overnight Recharge, which promised better quality sleep and improved energy. 

What is Benenox? 

Benenox contains three key ingredients that contirbute to a good night's sleep

Honey

The liver turns fructose and glucose into glycogen overnight, which the brain needs for repair. Without an adequated supply, the brain will believe there's a fuel crisis and you'll wake in the early hours.

Sustamine

This combination of two amino acids, L-Alanine and L-Glutamine slows down digestion, allowing the liver to store even more glycogen.

Vitamin B6

Reduces tiredness and fatigue and supports mental function.   

'Since these were the two issues plaguing my life I was keen to give it a go. I can honestly say that Benenox turned out to be complete magic,' she said. 

'And it’s natural so you don’t have to worry about becoming addicted.

“After a couple of weeks of taking every night, I began to notice some differences. 

'I stopped waking during the night, unless I needed the loo but then found got back to sleep much quicker! I also felt so different in the morning. 

'I never thought I’d be a morning person, but now, I’m not phased by the prospect of an early start. It's life changing.

'I am not only sleeping better but my energy levels are so much better, which has had a massive impact on my overall wellbeing, happiness and lifestyle. 

'Now, I have cut down from having eight cups of coffee a day to having just one first thing in the morning. I’ve also stopped eating as much sugar which has impacted more generally improved my health.' 

Parie, who is now studying to be a primary school teacher, said that her night time routine is also much improved.  

'Knowing that I am going to have a good night’s sleep means I much more content when I go to bed. 

'I look at my phone much less and I feel relaxed, allowing me to quickly and naturally drift off into a deep and restful night’s sleep.'

And even her father has benefited, after suffering from a chronic sleep issue.  

'He used to wake up at 4am every morning, without being able to go back to sleep. 

'He was prescribed medicine from the doctors, but that didn’t’ help in the long term. However, Benenox has transformed his sleep too, which he calls a "miracle".

it’s natural so you don’t have to worry about becoming addicted! I would urge anyone who struggles with sleep or who just needs more energy throughout the day, to give it a go!”
item.dc:abstract: Parie Joshi, 21, from Liverpool had six hours of broken hours a sleep and would wake up almost hourly for 20 minutes at a time, leaving her too exhausted to function the next day. After sleeping pills failed to health she discovered a natural supplement Benenox, £9.99, containing honey, which finally helped her to sleep through the night and restored her energy.
item.dc:creator: Siofra Brennan
item.mi:shortTitle: Natural £9.99 supplement cured a student's chronic insomnia

item.title: 'We can't sugarcoat it because that's not how these events happen': 13 Reasons Why actor who played the victim in graphic anal rape scene defends the controversial moment
item.description: Devin Druid, 20, stars as Tyler Down in the Netflix drama. A graphic anal rape scene in the second season has prompted backlash, but Devin insisted it wouldn't have been fair to 'censor' it.
item.content:encoded:
The actor who played the victim in an excruciating anal rape scene in 13 Reasons Why had defended the much-criticized moment, insisting it had to be graphic in order to be true to life.

Devin Druid, 20, stars as Tyler Down in the Netflix drama, whose second season premiered on May 18.

In the season finale, Tyler gets beaten and raped by three student-athletes, as one character, Monty, sodomizes him with the end of a mop.

Scroll down for video 

Critics of the rape scene have called it 'disgusting' and 'unnecessary,' while the Parents Television Council has issued an 'urgent warning' about the show.

But Devin spoke out in favor of the scene earlier this week during an interview in Hollywood, insisting it wouldn't have been fair to 'censor' it. 

'You know, I think people are always going to have opinions on the show and what we do, but I think it's staying true to what the show has been about,' he told ET at the 11th annual Television Academy Honors. 

'We can't sugarcoat it or censor it at all because that's not how these events happen. And I think it is this trying to portray and make people understand what happens in these unfortunate and tragic circumstances.'

The actor, who got his breakout role on 13 Reasons Why, explained how he approached the scene as a performer.

'As an actor for the scene I felt a lot of responsibility to accurately portray the pain and I guess the humiliation that one can go through when they're assaulted this way, especially with the stigma around sexual assault with men, and especially in this age of toxic and fragile masculinity,' he added.

'I think it plays a big part in this idea of men being raped — that's not something people thing about a lot.

'As a male character, what does that feel like for you in a society where you're told that this shouldn't happen to you? Not that it should happen to anybody, but that this can't happen to you, but it does? What does that do to you on a mental level, as well as physically, with enormous amounts of pain?' 

The second season of the Netflix series 13 Reasons Why has been by controversy over the disturbing rape scene, but the show's creator has stood by his decision to feature the graphic footage.

After receiving backlash for the depiction of Hannah Baker's suicide in the first season of the series, the new season begins with a PSA of the show's leading cast members warning that the series 'tackles tough, real world issues' — including sexual assault and school shooting storylines.  

After being ostracized by his peers in the first season of the show, Tyler pulls off a series of blackmail and vandalism stunts while seeking approval from a group of punk kids.

The loner is shunned by his so-called friends and sent to a behavioral rehab program after he gets caught vandalizing the school baseball field, resulting in a canceled season.

When he returns to school, school-athlete Monty (Timony Granaderos) and two other jocks follow him into the bathroom to sexually assault him as revenge. 

The disturbing scene begins with Monty bashing Tyler's head against the sink before calling him a 'f****t' and dragging him to a stall to dunk his head in the toilet. 

As Tyler pleads for mercy, the two other athletes hold him down while Monty takes a mop handle and forces it up his rectum. The excruciating pain is visible on Tyler's face, and when Monty finally removes the mop handle, it is covered with blood.

Monty tosses the mop on the ground before they leave, and Tyler is left crying on the ground, his head resting on the wall of the bathroom stall.

The two minute scene was directed by Kyle Patrick Alvarez, the same director who filmed the controversial depiction of Hannah (Katherine Langford) slitting her wrists in the bathtub in season one.

Critics have called this season's rape scene 'disgusting' and 'unnecessary,' while the Parents Television Council has issued an 'urgent warning' about the show. Referring to the new season as a 'ticking time bomb to teens and children,' the council has called for the cancellation of the series. 

For all the criticisms, there are also those who have supported the show's exploration and graphic depiction of real issues plaguing teens across the country.

13 Reasons Why creator Brian Yorkey has defended the inclusion of the scene, telling New York magazine's Vulture: 'We are committed on this show to telling truthful stories about things that young people go through in as unflinching a way as we can.' 

Last year, amid criticisms of the first season of the teen drama based on Jay Asher's best-selling book of the same name, Netflix added an additional warning card at the start of the series.  

Changes that were implemented for the new season include the custom introduction with the cast, an after show, and additional resources listed at 13ReasonsWhy.Info, including a viewing guide.

In his shared statement, Yorkey noted that Netflix has provided resources 'for understanding that this may not be the show for everybody,' as well as resources for those who are troubled by why they saw while watching it. 

'But the fact is that, as intense as that scene is, and as strong as are or reactions to it may be, it doesn’t even come close to the pain experienced by the people who actually go through these things,' he said. 

'When we talk about something being "disgusting" or hard to watch, often that means we are attaching shame to the experience. We would rather not be confronted with it. We would rather it stay out of our consciousness,' he added. 'This is why these kinds of assaults are underreported. This is why victims have a hard time seeking help. We believe that talking about it is so much better than silence.'

Yorkey claimed the storyline came from research on real-life cases of male-on-male sexual violence in high school, and he said the decision to include the scene was supported by both Netflix and Paramount, which produces the show, following 'extensive discussions.'

In the first season of the show, Hannah and Jessica Davis (Alisha Boe) are both raped by Bryce (Justin Prentice), and Yorkey pointed out that those scenes didn't receive the same amount of backlash because the victims were women. 

'The very, very intense scene of Hannah’s suicide seemed to overshadow the fact that Hannah and one other girl were violently raped in season one,' he said. 

'If there’s a greater sense of backlash about this scene, especially it being hard to watch, "disgusting," or inappropriate, that goes to the point that we need to be talking about the fact that things like this happen. 

'The fact that this would be somehow more disgusting than what happened to Hannah and Jessica, I’m shocked but not surprised.'  

The episode has also come under fire over a subsequent scene in which a traumatized Tyler takes an automatic rifle to the school dance with the intention of shooting his fellow students.

It is a continuation of the school shooting storyline that was introduced in the first season finale, and while he doesn't end up going through with the massacre, critics have found the scene to be troubling considering the unyielding plague of gun violence going on in the country. 

TWITTER REACTS TO GRAPHIC 13 REASONS WHY RAPE SCENE 

The second season of 13 Reasons Why premiered on Friday, May 18, at midnight Pacific time, and less than six hours later, Dimitrios Pagourtzis, 17, opened fire at Santa Fe High School near Houston, Texas, killing 10 people. 

Netflix canceled the Los Angeles premiere party scheduled on Friday evening for its second season because of the school shooting.

The controversial release also follows the February shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, in which 17 people were killed.   

Two weeks before the show's season two premiere, Yorkey opened up about Tyler's storyline, telling The Hollywood Reporter: 'We had a character who was obviously severely bullied, suffering from social isolation and was thinking of making a very tragic choice in addressing those feelings for himself.

'With season two ... we're very interested in continuing to follow his journey and to try to understand his state of mind and the state of his soul,' he continued. 'I think you'll see in the balance of the episodes that it's very much about trying to understand Tyler's character and how a troubled young man might be driven to consider this very difficult choice.'

The showrunner said it is up to the audience to decide of the show has successfully addressed the issue in a way that sparks conversation about gun violence without glorifying it.

'Unfortunately, there's a great deal of literature about a great number of troubled young men who resorted to or almost resorted to violence to act through their feelings,' he said. 'So we were able to study a great deal of the history there, and we tried to be authentic and honest and also accurate in our portrayal of the character. 

'As with all things with the show, our hope was that we could honestly represent the experience; that our viewers might, through the experience, learn more and start more conversations about those issues in their own world.'  

Season one of the series faced similar criticisms over Hannah's graphic suicide scene, as well as the depiction of two female characters being raped.

People accused the show of glorifying suicide, and many mental health professionals agreed that such a realistic portrayal could lead to copycat suicides among teens.

A graphic anal rape scene in the second season has prompted backlash, but Devin insisted it wouldn't have been fair to 'censor' it. 'We can't sugarcoat it or censor it at all because that's not how these events happen. And I think it is this trying to portray and make people understand what happens in these unfortunate and tragic circumstances,' he said in an interview in Hollywood earlier this week. Critics of the rape scene have called it 'disgusting' and 'unnecessary,' while the Parents Television Council has issued an 'urgent warning' about the show.

item.title: Death-defying! Acrobatic brothers CRASH to the ground while doing terrifying stunts on America's Got Talent - but still get back up and finish their act much to the judges' horror
item.description: The Fratelli Rossi act consists of two brothers from Spain who admitted at the beginning of their performance that one of them recently had an ACL injury after falling during a stunt.
item.content:encoded:
An acrobatic brother duo performed death defying stunts on America's Got Talent, but they shocked judges when they crashed during their performance only to get up and finish the act.

The Fratelli Rossi act consists of two brothers from Spain who admitted at the beginning of their performance that one of them recently had an ACL injury after falling during a stunt.

To the horror of the audience and judges, that same brother came crashing down during one of the tumbling acts with his sibling. 

Scroll down for video 

The brothers perform a dangerous act where one person does back flips onto the other performer's legs while they keep them propped up in the air. 

At the beginning of the act, the duo appeared to be on the right track after nailing some tricky flips without any difficulty.

But just as one brother attempted to land on the other's feet, he came tumbling down to the ground.

The brothers remained on the ground briefly while one of them checked his knee to make sure he hadn't injured the leg again. 

While the audience watched in horror, the acrobatic act was able to stand up together and implored the stage manager to restart the music so they could finish the performance. 

Judge Mel B shouted: 'No, don't, you're not doing it again.' 

Her colleague Howie Mendel agreed saying, '“No more! No more!', while Heidi Klum and Simon Cowell watched on in horror. 

But to the judges dismay, the brothers started where their act left off before the tumble to the ground. 

They quickly got the crowd back on their side after they landed flip after flip miraculously. 

By the end of the performance, every judge besides Simon Cowell was on their feet cheering on the duo.  

'I mean, you guys are absolutely incredible,' Heidi said at the end of the act. 

Despite not giving a standing ovation, Simon also joined in on the praise for the act after they overcame the crash.

'I think it’s not always right to judge these acts on being technically perfect,' Simon said. 

'The fact that you went wrong and then you did it again actually made the act even better. I was really on the edge of my seat.'

All four judges voted yes for Fratelli Rossi to move onto the next round of the auditions.
item.dc:abstract: The Fratelli Rossi act consists of two brothers from Spain who admitted at the beginning of their performance that one of them recently had an ACL injury after falling during a stunt. To the horror of the audience and judges, that same brother came crashing down during one of the tumbling acts with his sibling. The brothers perform a dangerous act where one person does back flips onto the others legs while they keep them propped up in the air. After the fall, they stood up and continued the act to the surprise of the America's Got Talent audience and judges.

item.mi:shortTitle: Acrobatic brothers CRASH to the ground during America's Got Talent

item.title: 'Suddenly very invested in the World Cup!’ Viral photo of Iran’s VERY dapper national football squad leaves new fans swooning
item.description: A photo of the Iranian World Cup squad has caused a sensation on social media ahead of the tournament. The snap of players including Sardar Azmoun in dapper blue suits has gone viral.
item.content:encoded:
World Cup fever is set to officially take hold when the tournament kicks off next week - and those uninterested in the action on the pitch are taking comfort in the eye candy.

A photo of Iran's national squad looking suave in matching suits sent Twitter into meltdown when it was shared online.   

The snap of the tall dark and handsome line-up was shared by Twitter user Aminatou Sow, who posted: 'All of a sudden very invested in the Iranian world cup squad'.

And it seems she's not the only person whose support Iran can now count on - as it's been liked and shared thousands of times by new fans who said the squad left them 'breathless'. 

The players seen in the snap include Sardar Azmoun, who has been dubbed 'the Iranian Messi', Morteza Pouraliganji, Alireza Jahanbahksh, Saeed Ezatollahi, Ramin Rezaian, Karim Ansarifard, and Mehdi Taremi.

'This picture left me breathless,' said one Twitter user.

'Wow can't believe I will be watching the World Cup this year. Who am I?' another replied. 

'Well all of a sudden I have a team to root for,' said another, while one person added: 'I have always been very supportive of football.'

The shot of the Persian team all wearing matching blue suits even lead some to suggest they were in the wrong place, and better suited to the line-up of US reality show The Bachelorette than the beautiful game.  

The photo appears to have been taken on the same day as official photos of the squad snapped ahead of the World Cup tournament, which will see Iran take on Morocco in their first match next Friday.  

A full group shot was posted on Team Melli's official account in Istanbul two days ago, before they started their journey to Russia.

The 2018 FIFA World Cup is taking place in Moscow, Russia and the Iranian team were the first Asian team to qualify for a spot in the prestigious tournament.

They landed in the country on Thursday evening to begin training at the Lokomotiv Bakovka Training Base ahead of their clash with Morocco. .
item.dc:abstract: A photo of the Iranian World Cup squad has caused a sensation on social media ahead of the tournament, with newly anointed football fans declaring the picture of the squad in suits had left them 'breathless'. Seen left to right are Sardar Azmoun, who has been dubbed the 'Iranian Messi', Morteza Pouraliganji, Alireza Jahanbahksh, Saeed Ezatollahi, Ramin Rezaian, Karim Ansarifard, and Mehdi Taremi.
item.dc:creator: Kerry Mcdermott
item.mi:shortTitle: Suave image of Iranian world cup football team has Twitter swooning

item.title: No rest for this royal bridegroom! Newlywed Prince Harry gets back to work after his honeymoon with Meghan by hosting a charity gala with David Walliams
item.description: The royal, 33, last night hosted a summer gala dinner for the charity charity gala at Kensington Palace in aid of the charity On Side Youth Zones along with comedian David Walliams.
item.content:encoded:
He's just returned from honeymoon with his new bride Meghan, but Prince Harry has wasted no time in getting back to work. 

The royal last night hosted a summer gala dinner for the charity charity gala at Kensington Palace in aid of the charity On Side Youth Zones along with comedian David Walliams. 

Harry, 33, looked in great spirits as he laughed and joked with guests at the event in aid of the charity, which provides spaces for eight to 19-year-olds where they can enjoy fun and active leisure activities, especially in deprived communities.

Host David Walliams reportedly made guests laugh as he introduced the prince as a newly-married man, although his new wife Meghan was not in attendance at the event. 

Scroll down for video 

Businessman Davy Price shared a snap of himself chatting to the Prince on Instagram, and said they chatted about the Inspire Youth charity, which his property development company supports. 

As well as chatting about the pressures young people face on their mental health, he added: 'We maaay have also talked about helicopters. Absolute gentleman.' 

 The prince looked exceptionally dapper in a tuxedo for the event and took to the stage to make a speech. 

Guests were later entertained by being treated to a set by '80s singer Rick Astley. 

Details of Harry and Meghan's honeymoon still remain a closely guarded secret. 

They remained in the UK for a few days after their wedding and attended a garden party to mark Prince Charles' 70th birthday on the Tuesday after their big day. 

 They have not been seen publicly since, and were rumoured to be enjoying a romantic stay at the Fairmont Jasper Park Lodge in Alberta, Canada.

According to reports, they finished off their break with a short stay in Ireland, before returning to London. 

Earlier this week they were rumoured to be staying at the 13th-century Ashford Castle in Cong, County Mayo where rooms cost between £600 and £4,000 a night.

The rumour mill went into overdrive after local woman Rachel Forde tweeted: 'The first time I go to Ashford Castle and we couldn't get into the [actual] castle and around it because the royals are within.'

The sprawling five-star estate - once named as the 'world's best hotel' - is a firm favourite with celebrities including Pierce Brosnan and was the wedding venue of golfer Rory McIlroy when he tied the knot with Erica Stoll in April 2017.

It also has a rich royal history; the dining room and bar were named after Harry's great-great-grandfather King George V, one of Ashford's famous guests over the years.  

Meghan's first post-honeymoon appearance will take place tomorrow, when she joins the royals for her first Trooping The Colour, held in honour of the Queen's birthday.

Earlier this week, it was announced that Meghan would be conducting her first joint engagements with the Queen in Cheshire next week.

The military parade is attended by senior members of the royal family including Prince Charles, the Duchess of Cornwall and the Duke and Duchess of Sussex.

It is not clear if Prince Louis, who is just six weeks old, will join his parents at Buckingham Palace, although Prince George and Princess Charlotte are expected to attend, as in previous years.

In an unprecedented move, the Duchess of Sussex will be travelling with the head of state on the royal train.

Only the most senior members of the Royal Family – namely the Queen, Prince Philip, Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall - are entitled to use it.

Harry, Kate and William are not believed to have ever used it in an official capacity.
item.dc:abstract: The royal, 33, last night hosted a summer gala dinner for the charity charity gala at Kensington Palace in aid of the charity On Side Youth Zones along with comedian David Walliams. Harry looked dapper in a tuxedo and seemed in great spirits as he laughed and joked with guests at his first post-honeymoon engagement.

item.title: Now THAT'S meal prep! Healthy food blogger reveals how she whips up a month of nutritious dinners for just 88p per person (and says she can do it all in one DAY)
item.description: Rhian Allen, founder of The Healthy Mummy, from Wales, shares her £106 meal plan for a family of four. It makes 120 meals which lasts her family 30 days and she cooks it all in eight hours.
item.content:encoded:
A thrifty mother has revealed how you can feed a family of four healthy dinners for a month on a grocery budget of £100 - or just 88p per person per day. 

Entrepreneur Rhian Allan, who was raised in Wales but now lives in Sydney, says the key to cutting down grocery bill costs is to meal prep her nutritious dinners - all packed with fruit and vegetables - in advance by cooking a month's worth of food in one go.

The mother-of-two, who is the founder of hugely popular weight loss programme The Healthy Mummy, has shared her monthly meal plan listing snacks and dinners that will feed her family for 30 days - as she launches her business in the UK for the first time.

Rhian, whose business is worth $20 million and has helped hundreds of thousands of Australian women lose weight, says she wants to show busy mothers how healthy eating doesn't have to be expensive.

She showed how mothers can take one day to cook up a huge feast of dinners that will last a family for a whole month as they can all be stored in the freezer. They will also keep in the fridge for up to five days.

Without snacks, her grocery bill for the batch meals came to £106 - which works out at less than 88p per serving. The ingredients make enough for eight portions in two batches of 15 different dinners - or 120 individual meals.

With ingredients for 40 portions of four homemade snacks, her bill came to £146.

Every meal Rhian made during her epic meal prep session was taken from her 28 Day Weight Loss Challenge, which she has created more than 4,000 recipes for.

Rhian's Spanish rice with chorizo 

. 1 cup brown rice, uncooked (160 grams): 24p

. 2 chorizo sausages, chopped (280 grams): £2.70

. 1 brown onion, diced (100 grams): 15p

. 1 tsp smoked paprika (1 gram): 2p

. 4 tomatoes, diced (400 grams): £1.10p

. 1 cup frozen peas (160 grams): 20p

. 1 cup corn kernels, fresh or tinned (160 grams): 20p

. 1 red pepper, diced (100 grams): 55p

. 1 tablespoon fresh parsley (5 grams): 6p

. 4 limes (120 grams): 35p

TOTAL:  £5.37

Rhian said she had to cook for eight hours to finish making all 120 of the dinners - but said that it saves time cooking later on.

She said: 'This took me around eight hours to do but means I don’t have to cook again for a long time and because I am cooking in bulk I am saving so much money.

'So although it is hard work, it is 100 per cent worth it.'

She added: 'The Healthy Mummy meals are designed with a holistic approach, with no food group being cut out, everything in moderation and the most importantly, delicious.' 

Rhian Allen's £106 monthly meal plan

Makes 8 portions of each meal in two batches

Creamy Chicken & Corn Soup

Brazilian Beans with Greens & Rice

Spanish Rice with Chorizo 

Easy Fried Rice 

Lentil Shepherd’s Pie 

Peanut Butter Chicken Curry 

Sausage & Veggie Pasta Bake 

Beef & Sweet Potato Lasagne 

Tuna Pasta Bake 

Baked Cheese & Tomato Risotto 

Mexican Style Chilli Con Carne

Simple Zucchini & Bacon Slice

Coconut Chicken Nuggets

Chilli Tuna Patties with Asian Coleslaw

Pesto, Spinach & Ricotta Rolls 

£1.08/serving

95p/serving   

£1.28/serving 

56p/serving 

£1.11/serving 

£1.31/serving 

98p/serving 

£1.31/serving 

£1.21/serving 

92p/serving 

£1.05/serving

£1.11/serving 

£1.11/serving 

£1.02/serving 

33p/serving 

Grocery bill total: £106

Snacks: 

Raspberry Muffins (12 in 2 batches)

Cherry Choc Slice (10 in 2 batches)

Healthy Chocolate Weetbix Slice (12 in 2 batches)

Peppermint Choc Slice (14 in 2 batches)

37p/serving

25p/serving

18p/serving

 

43p/serving 

Total: £146 

The bill does not factor in the cost of salt, pepper and spices

Rhian Allen reveals how to save money when meal prepping

1. Save even more by making the three rice based meals on my 28 Day Weight Loss Challenge with the same type of rice (instead of buying jasmine, brown and basmati)

2. Save even more by bulking out your recipes with any vegetables that are on sale, as most of our recipes are quite flexible and forgiving

3. Save even more by growing your own basil, parsley and coriander at home in the garden or in a window box instead of buying them by the bunch

4. Save even more by switching up some of the proteins to either whatever meat is on sale when you shop, or substitute with tofu or chickpeas instead

5. I purposely chose recipes with similar ingredients as this helps save money at the checkout (e.g. many have rice, or pasta)

6. These are all kid friendly recipes too, there’s no need to cook two different meals for adults and kids

7. On average the main meals here work out at under 88p per serve, so you can lose weight AND save money at the same time

8. These meals freeze well, so cook double and enjoy the other portion later (saves on washing up too) 

Rhian's peanut butter chicken curry 

 . 1 cup basmati rice, uncooked (180 grams): 27p

. 4 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil (20 mls): 10p

. 1 brown onion, finely chopped (100 grams): 15p

. 2 cloves garlic, minced (6 grams): 15p

. 400 grams chicken breast fillets: £2.50

. 1 tsp fresh ginger, minced (4 grams): 35p

. 2 tsp ground coriander (2 grams): 2p

. 1 tsp ground cumin (1 grams): n/a*

. 1 tsp ground turmeric (1 grams): n/a

. 1 cup liquid chicken stock, salt reduced (250 mls): 13p

. 400 grams tinned tomatoes: 34p

. 1/2 cup peanut butter (96 grams): 75p

. 1 tsp garam masala (1 grams): n/a

. 1 cup reduced-fat Greek natural yogurt (260 grams): 85p

. 1 tablespoon fresh coriander, chopped (5 grams): 6p

* Items already assumed to be in pantry

TOTAL:  £4.65

Rhian founded The Healthy Mummy after she was frustrated to find there was no national or holistic support system to help women 'shape up' or get healthy after giving birth following her pregnancy with her first child in 2010.

She then researched the possibility of creating a safe and healthy plan of her own before taking a leap of faith and quitting her corporate job of 12 years, selling her house and investing every dollar she owned into the idea.

Now, eight years on, Rhian's business The Healthy Mummy is the biggest 'mums only' healthy eating and weight loss program in the world and continues to grow.

An employer of 150 people, she has now helped hundreds of thousands of women lose weight - often several stone at a time - with her healthy eating plan.

She has now launched her weight loss platform in the UK for the first time and plans to launch in the US next year.

She lives in Australia but was raised in Wales and has just launched her weight loss programme in the UK.

item.title: Spoil Dad no matter what your budget! FEMAIL reveals the most stylish Father's Day gifts on the high street (with prices starting at just £8.99)
item.description: Femail has scoured the high street to find the best treats to put a smile on dad's face next Sunday, and with prices starting at just £8.99, there's something to suit every budget.
item.content:encoded:
If you're looking for Father's Day inspiration and don't want to resort to the tired old options of a grooming set or some novelty item that will end up in the charity shop bag, there are plenty of stylish buys on the high street that won't break the bank. 

Femail has scoured the high street to find the best treats to put a smile on dad's face next Sunday, and with prices starting at just £8.99, there's something to suit every budget. 

Foodies will delighted in a hamper of Italian goodies, a top-of-the-range BBQ for family cook ups and luxury spirits and champagne. 

Tech lovers will delight in Moleskine's smart writing set or the Google Home Smart Speaker, we've also picked the best of the best from classic options such as aftershave and clothing. 

UNDER £50

Dadmin Hero Mug  £9.99 

A perfect gift for the father who is always on the go, this fun mug gives a nod to his neverending list of daddy duties! 

But you should definitely encourage him to use it to put his feet up with a cuppa on Father's Day, or use it for his tea or coffee if you're serving breakfast in bed.  

  

Shop
Palmi Large Grained Leather Journal  £19.50 

Sleek and simply styled without unnecessary trim, the Palmi brings you a premium-quality leather journal at a fraction of the cost.  All Pen Heaven's journals are handmade in one workshop in Italy from only the finest Italian leather and other local materials. 

Add a personal message with the in-house embossing service.

Shop
The Luna Cinema tickets  £17.50  

Get Dad a couple of tickets to watch his favourite classic film with the leading providers of outdoor cinema in stunning locations around the country - from Lincoln Castle to Westminster Abbey. 

With a range of films from classics such as Top Gun to this year's favourites including The Shape of Water, there's something to suit all tastes.

Shop
Prada Luna Rossa Black Eau de Parfum  £47.15 

Sharp fresh citrus with musky undertones. Prada Luna Rossa Black is a all day fragrance that suits a work or play setting. 

It opens with a bright flash of vivacious bergamot and magnetic angelica facets. In the heart sophistication lingers as patchouli and coumarin build, before an amber base makes for a moody signature. 

Shop
Lanson Black Label & Exclusive Champagne Stopper  £40  

Generally regarded as one of the world’s finest suppliers of the luxurious gold stuff, Lanson Black remains true to the lofty standards that have come to define its heritage, with a crisp palate of ripe fruits and citrus rounded off with a full-bodied lingering finish. It even arrives complete with an exclusive free stopper (because a fizz deficit in refreshment this decadent should surely be a crime) 

Shop
Citadelle Gin  £31

If your dad is a purist and loves a bit of French sophistication, treat him to a bottle of Citadelle, the original craft gin from Cognac, France, with over 60 awards and medals to its name. Distilled in copper pot stills over an open flame, it is a juniper-led gin with a soft texture and a light, natural sweetness. The signature serve is a Gin&Tonic with a lemon twist served with a side of oysters, and voila! 

Shop
Pierre Marcolini chocolate ganaches with fruits and flowers  £19

Perfect for the discerning chocolate lover, these flower-infused ganaches of house chocolate are coupled with different fruit compotes and are brimming with smooth and fruity flavours. The fragrance of jasmine, the scent of roses and the soft aromas of verbena are combined with the sun-drenched and powerful notes of citrus fruits. 

Shop
L’Occitane Men’s Travel Collection  £20

Treat your dad with this must-have collection of indulgent mini grooming treats, which include a shower gel, repairing shampoo, shaving gel, scented soap, comforting cream and a stylish travel bag. 

Shop
Chocolate paintbrushes  £20  

Whether you’re looking to surprise your very own Handy Andy, or to delight the budding painter in your life, our chocolate paintbrushes are true works of art.

This tempting trio has been handmade in Somerset from wonderfully creamy dark, white, and milk Belgian chocolate, and decorated to look just like the real thing. From the edible-silver-dusted handles to the gloriously thick colourful chocolate ‘paint’ at the tips, these three brushes are far too stunning to be enjoyed alone in the shed. 

Shop
The Man on The Middle Floor  £8.99 

Three People: Two Murders: One House. The perfect gift for an inquisitive father who enjoys books that spark conversation. 

This must-read about an autistic murderer which examines society's attitude to Asperger' alongside the twists and turns.

Shop
Diplomatico Reserva Exclusiva  £41.95

Diplomatico is a real crowd pleaser in a bottle that will up the style ante of any drinks cabinet. One of the most awarded rums, the Reserva Exclusiva holds more than 20 medals to its name.  Best enjoyed neat, on the rocks, but can also be used in elegant cocktails such as Old Fashioned and Sazerac.

 

Shop
The Glenfiddich IPA whisky  £45
Part of Glenfiddich's Experimental Series, this single malt was finished for three months in casks which previously held IPA. Created by Glenfiddich Malt Master Brian Kinsman and IPA expert Seb Jones, the IPA was in the casks before the whisky was specially brewed; bound to be a fascinating whisky for whisky and beer enthusiasts alike.
Shop

£50 TO £100

East of Eden  £70 

When the latest paperback doesn't feel like enough of a treat for the dad who loves reading, The Folio Society's beautifully illustrated and presented books are a winner. 

'The Folio Socity edition of East of Eden, by John Steinbeck, introduced by Michael Dirda and illustrated by Edward Kinsella is exclusively available from The Folio Society. 

Shop
God of war  £52.99 
Living as a man outside the shadow of the gods, Kratos must adapt to unfamiliar lands, unexpected threats and a second chance at being a father. Together with his son Atreus, the pair will venture into the brutal realm of Midgard and fight to fulfil a deeply personal quest..  This is a real action packed favourite with glowing reviews across the board
Shop
Happy Fathers Day Hamper  £65

A great gift for Dads who love good food. 

This gourmet hamper contains an indulgent selection of delicious Italian products that any foodie Dad will appreciate, from a bottle of our favourite, multi award winning organic Chianti to a luxurious southern Italian dark chocolates filled with luscious Creme Caramel. 

Shop
London Sock Co. Six Pairs  £69

This luxury sock gift is designed for men who enjoy the brighter side of life. Treat your dad to a gift box of luxury men’s cotton socks that will add instant colour and style to any ensemble. This gift set includes six colourful styles from London Sock Co.’s Simply Sartorial range, finely knitted from their luxury Scottish Lisle cotton yarns. The perfect sock gift guaranteed to brighten up any gentleman’s sock drawer. 

Shop
Original Penguin Brushed Oxford Long Sleeve Shirt £55

This heritage fit Oxford shirt is a sleek addition to any fashion forward father's wardrobe. It can be easily paired with denim jeans for a casual look and is made of brushed cotton for warmth and comfort. With a small logo as a seal of approval this timeless shirt is an easy-go-to. 

Shop
Fire TV with 4K  £69.99

Experience true-to-life picture quality and sound with access to vivid 4K Ultra HD up to 60 fps, HDR and Dolby Atmos audio. 10,000+ channels, apps and Alexa skills with access to over 200,000 movies and TV episodes from the BBC, Prime Video, Netflix, ITV, Curzon, UKTV Play, and more 

Shop
The North Face Borealis Rage Backpack £81

The North Face has updated the classic Borealis backpack by giving its suspension system an overhaul and adding easier-access pockets. 

Ideal for regular walks, commutes and urban adventures, this everyday pack is a great option for the dad who loves the outdoors.

Shop
The Dark Chocolate Cabinet with Red Wine  £75

A collection Hotel Chocolat's most sought-after dark recipes matched with a 75cl bottle of our exclusive red wine, specially selected to accompany our best chocolates. Gift bag included. 

This is definitely chocolate for grown-ups with impeccable taste. Let's just hope Dad is willing to share! 

Shop
Patria 'Jack' sweartshirt £99

British luxury menswear brand Patria's sweatshirt features Jack, an Airedale Terrier famed for crawling two miles through no-man’s land to deliver a message that rescued a battalion during World War One. 

Like all Patria products, 10% goes to the veteran’s charities 

Shop
Haig Club Whisky 12x5cl Miniature  £54

Up the style stakes this Father’s Day and treat your Dad to a set of miniatures from Haig Club in striking blue bottles. Haig Club is the stylish Single Grain Scotch Whisky produced in partnership with David Beckham, and these small servings are perfect for a nip of warming whiskey on a camping or fishing trip. 

Shop
Charles Bentley Double Acacia Deck Chair £79.99

Let your dad take some time to lounge in the sun this summer with this chic foldable deck hair. 

Featuring three reclining positions, this double wooden deck chair is available in a beautiful shade of teal, ideal for adding a burst of colour to the garden, beach or relaxing by the pool on holiday.

Shop
Brown leather men's bracelet  £50

This brown leather men's bracelet is perfect for the stylish dad who is partial to a sleek accessory. 

The vintage-inspired bracelet is designed in stainless steel with a brown leather plaited bracelet and has a timeless feel. Can be worn solo or layered with other pieces for a modern look.

Shop

OVER £100 

Weber Master-Touch GBS 57cm Charcoal Barbecue - Crimson  £239.99

For the dad who loves to BBQ, this sleek Weber Master-Touch 57cm Charcoal Barbecue comes in a subtle crimson red hue which offers a classy alternative to black. 

It's ideal for family cook ups as the 57cm grate is roomy enough to cook for eight. Buy this Barbecue & get a FREE Weber Chimney Starter Set (while stocks last) 

Shop
Flymo Speedi-Mo 360C + Mini Trim  £119

Give your green fingers dad a new lease of life with this height adjustable mower and trimmer. 

Ideal for most garden sizes, this fantastic mower is able to achieve a distinctive cut that will leave your dad's home the envy of his neighbours. 

Shop
Dreamland membership  £190

Treat dad to a membership at the utterly charming Dreamland theme park on the Kent coast with lovingly restored Victorian rides and modern favourites. A Family Membership can be any combination of adults and children and can have up to five members included. After enjoying all the fun of the fair you can enjoy 10 per cent off food at Cinque Ports, offering all your favourites from hearty burgers to salads served by ultra friendly staff 

Shop
Moleskine Smart Writing Set  £199

Moleskine has launched a specially designed notebook, pen, and app that work in tandem to instantly digitise notes and sketches made on paper, creating digital text and images that can be edited and shared immediately with a phone, tablet, or laptop.

This new design is an exciting innovation from the classic brand that will delight the creative man in your life.

Shop
 NALA 16-piece cutlery set £144

Featuring an ombre effect, Nala has a luxurious chocolate coloured coating which blends from long, elegant matt handles out to a bright mirror polish, bringing a modern look to the table. 

Perfect for the dad with an eye for style who loves to entertain. 

Shop
Nespresso by Krups Vertuo  £129

Be your own barista with this black Nespresso® Vertuo machine by Krups. It’s compatible with the Vertuo range of Nespresso® capsules, so you can explore a variety of delicious blends. There are four drink sizes to choose from including a 40ml Espresso, 150ml Gran Lungo, 230ml Mug and 414ml Alto, 

Shop
Ecco Vitrus 1  £180
This technologically advanced shoe is the ideal everyday luxury for busy dads. Providing exceptional comfort with classic style, it can be easily paired with fitted trousers or chinos and a blazer for a tailored look. The anatomically shaped platform complements the natural curvature of the foot and encourages natural movement.
Shop
Google Home Smart Speaker  £116

This smart speaker can handle a world of tasks at your command, from researching answers to questions, reminding you of appointments, giving you the latest news or even telling jokes. It’s also compatible with popular music streaming services, so you can simply ask for your favourite track and you’ll be dancing around the house in no time. 

Shop
Solidteknics pan  £127.90

This 26cm Skillet is Solidteknics' bestselling pan, a real workhorse skillet pan loved by chefs the world over. It's a versatile all-rounder, outperforming its heavier cast-iron equivalents. It's sold exclusively by buymeonce.com, which has a beautifully curated selection of products designed to last a lifetime. 

Shop
Camden Watch Co. No.29 Brown and Navy.  £110

The father who has everything will love this classic watch inspired by Victorian pocket watches such as those worn by Camden train workers in the 1900s. The durable leather strap paired with silver hardware adds a polished finish to any outfit. 

Shop
Barbour Black Padded Wax Jacket  £135

Every man deserves a top quality black jacket ahead of the winter months. This classic country style Barbour jacket is more water resistant than other fabrics and can be easily paired with tweed pieces for a complete look.

Shop
30 Minute Introductory Flying Lesson  £104

Available at 33 locations across the country, this incredible flying lesson from buyagift.com will arm you with the knowledge you need to fly a real light aircraft for the very first time. 

The day starts with an introduction to an  expert instructor to learn all the basic manoeuvres required to feel confident enough to really enjoy taking control of the plane

Shop

item.title: Is the decluttering craze losing you money? Expert reveals the valuable items you should NEVER give to the charity shop - including old crockery and costume jewellery
item.description: Estate sale expert Jacquie Denny, told US site Apartment Therapy many of her clients make the costly mistake of assuming that things they no longer like - such as old jewellery - won't hold any value.
item.content:encoded:
From Marie Kondo's bestselling books to endless decluttering experts sharing their wisdom on Instagram, the drive to live a more minimalist life is definitely having a moment. 

But now an expert has warned that in your eagerness to declutter, you could be losing out by giving away too many belongings to charities or friends.

Jacquie Denny, co-founder of online estate sale company Everything But the House, told Apartment Therapy that many of her clients make the costly mistake of assuming that things they don't like won't hold any value. 

A good rule of thumb is to go by condition and rarity, she said, meaning that any item from jewellery to furniture is likely to be worth something if it's well preserved and has some unique feature or is relatively hard to get hold of. 

She also revealed the items that currently have the highest resale values at the moment, including '70s velvet sofas - which are currently on trend - as well as oriental rugs and costume jewellery. 

Read on to find out if you potentially have a gold mine of forgotten treasures gathering dust.  

CHINA

China is not as sought after as it used to be as people favour casual dining and millennials opt for honeymoon donations as wedding gifts over formal dinner settings. 

However, vintage pieces by designers such as Lenox, Rosenthal, and Diane von Furstenberg are the items most likely to fetch you a decent return.  

CHILDHOOD TOYS

Star Wars Lego sets in the box and in perfect condition from the '70s could earn you as much as $800 (£600).

But don't despair if you don't have the box. If a toy is rare, or you have one that was limited edition or an unusual colour you could still get around $100 for it. 

And if you have a retro version of a toy that corresponds with a current movie such as Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles or Transformers then it's likely to have value. 

COSTUME JEWELLERY 

It's not just family heirlooms or fine jewellery that could be worth something. 

Retro costume jewllery or anything from a popular brand such as Kenneth Jay Lane is worth selling on. 

VELVET SOFAS

Velvet sofas are all the rage again, but some people might remember them from the first time around in the 1970s.   

Mid-century modern is also likely to attract buyers. 

ORIENTAL RUGS 

Carpets are out and wooden floors are in, meaning that rugs in good condition are in demand.  

TECHNOLOGY  

Early iMac and Apple computers can sell for thousands, but more modern tech doesn't hold value. 

If you don't sell on your iPhone the next time you upgrade, it will drop in value as more new versions are released and you'll have to wait decades for its price to rise again. 

Either sell or trade in your old phone as soon as you upgrade and do a cull of any tech from the past few years that's lying round the house.
item.dc:abstract: Estate sale expert Jacquie Denny, told the US website Apartment Therapy that many of her clients make the costly mistake of assuming that things they no longer like - such as old jewellery - won't hold any value.
item.dc:creator: Kerry Mcdermott

item.title: 'I heard a baby crying in the middle of the night': People reveal their SCARIEST tales of the unexplained in hair-raising online thread
item.description: In a chilling new thread on British website Mumsnet, parents have been revealing the scariest things that have happened to them that they can't explain or just don't understand.
item.content:encoded:
It is easy to be sceptical of the supernatural, however even the most pragmatic of people might be a little disturbed by these terrifying tales.

In a chilling new Mumsnet thread people have revealed the scariest and most inexplicable experiences.

Among the stories was one shared by a woman who had received an anonymous voicemail from someone making demonic hissing sounds.

Another said their young child had drawn a picture of a ghost at a family member's house that was known to be haunted.

Another mother told how as a child she'd been woken in the night by the sound of 'weird hymns' being sung outside her bedroom window.  

The thread was started by Mumsnet user HughLauriesStubble, who asked people to share their 'unexplainable freaky experiences'.

They said that when they were 12-years-old they had stayed up until 3am with their cousin when a stranger started shining torches into their room.

They said: 'It was a terrifying experience, and still gives me the heebie jeebies even now.'

Hoards of other Mumsnet users responded to the thread, posting some very sinister stories.

Many had experiences with the afterlife, including one who said they felt their mother stroking their hair the day after she died.

One said: 'My mother died 10 years ago and the day after I was in a twilight sleep when she started stroking my hair and saying 'Why don't you let people know how wonderful you are?' It was real and I was startled. 

'Upon feeling my fear she was pulled swiftly back into ''the light.'' This all happened just above my head.'

Another said: 'After my granddad died I was waiting in a car on my own (about 7 years old) and saw his reflection sat behind me in the rear view mirror facing the same way as me. When I turned around there was no one there.' 

Others recalled some terrifying phone calls they'd had from unknown callers.

One said: 'I once was half asleep, drifting off and heavily medicated when I heard my house phone ringing at 10.00pm. I dragged myself out of bed and picked it up but just heard noise in the background and hung up. 

'I went back to bed and fell to sleep. The next day I saw I had a missed call from my house phone at 1.30am in the morning on my mobile and a voicemail and it was of someone making hissing noises and somewhat demonic sounds. But there wasn't anybody in the house apart from me.'

Another wrote: 'When I was about 20, I lived in a flat with my then boyfriend. He was away overseas for work and I was home alone. I had a really long hot shower (hair mask, full shave, exfoliate etc) and came out of the shower into the bedroom. 

'My landline rang and I answered it and it was my mum.. 'What the bloody he'll do you think you are doing?' Me - 'erm. What?' Mum - 'answering your phone and heavy breathing and whispering down the phone?!?!' [sic].'
item.dc:abstract: In a chilling new thread on British website Mumsnet, parents have been revealing the scariest things that have happened to them that they can't explain or just don't understand. One person revealed that they received an anonymous voicemail from someone making demonic hissing sounds.

item.title: 'I was sabotaging myself with food': Gym instructor, 29, whose weight soared to 117kg after she lost the urge to stop eating sheds 43kg after she made a drastic lifestyle overhaul
item.description: Australian woman Kristy Goodwin, 29, whose weight spiralled out of control after food became her coping mechanism has spoken out about how she overcame her crippling binge eating disorder.
item.content:encoded:
A 29-year-old woman whose weight spiralled out of control after food became her coping mechanism has dropped five dress sizes.

Kristy Goodwin, originally from Perth but who now lives in Queensland, suffered from a binge eating disorder for most part of her life.

She overindulged on copious amounts of food because she never felt satisfied - and she was unable to stop herself from eating despite already having a full meal - a lifestyle that saw her tip the scales at 117kg at her heaviest.

But, determined to get on top of her weight once and for all, she made a drastic lifestyle overhaul that helped her shed 43kg.

Speaking to Daily Mail Australia, the gym instructor - who now looks unrecognisable - shared her incredible body transformation after she overcame her crippling condition.

What is a binge eating disorder? 

Binge eating disorder is a serious mental health condition.

It affects people of all ages and from all backgrounds, and is the most common eating disorder in Australia. 

People with binge eating disorder regularly eat large quantities of food in a short time frame and feel unable to stop themselves from eating.

Many people with binge eating disorder are overweight or obese, but being overweight or obese does not mean you have binge eating disorder. 

Credit: Better Health 

'I couldn't control the amount of food I was eating, no matter how full or how much I'd eaten, I still didn't feel that content feeling. I was sabotaging myself with food,' she said.

'I didn't feel that urge to stop, I would eat and eat and eat. Once I've had a meal, an hour later, I would eat the same amount of food again.'

She said breakfast and lunchtimes started out at normal portion sizes - but by mid-afternoon she would binge on multiple meals until dinner.

'Breakfast, morning tea and lunch were reasonably good. But as the day progressed, I would binge really hard and it always seemed to be from mid-afternoon,' she said.

'Anywhere between then towards dinner, I would eat meals that were nearly the same size as a man's portion or sometimes, it would be double the size.

'An hour from eating my meal, I would do it all over again. Weekends seemed to be really bad, I was occupied with work, so I would eat copious amounts of food.

'It didn't matter how well I was eating during the week, I would eat massive amounts of food over my three-day weekends.'

Kristy admitted she hardly ate fast foods or junk, but her eating habit saw her binge on meals she ordered from nice restaurants.

'I remember ordering a lot of things off Uber Eats,' she said. 

'For example, I would order a few things off the menu, and I'd mentally tell myself I would save it for the next couple of days. But when my order arrived, I would eat it all in one sitting.'

Her turning point to lose weight came after she noticed stretch marks appearing in unusual areas of her body.

'I started noticing stretch marks appearing in places no one else had them - middle of my stomach, on my arms, front of my arms, boobs, inner thigh, backs of my legs,' she said. 

'I had no idea I was that big that my body was starting to stretch to a size that my skin couldn't deal with.'

And so, she decided to embark on a weight loss journey where she astonishingly lost 45kg naturally through diet and exercise.

'I enrolled at a gym, had a gym partner and the classes were fun. I even took part in a 12 week challenge and I was educated about healthy eating,' she said. 

'I remember feeling happy with myself, I loved myself and I was no longer restricting my meals. I was eating normally like what an average person would eat.'

But Kristy started struggling to keep the weight off for good.

'In 2013, I was offered a job in the mines so I was working 12-hour days, six days a week. I didn't have access to a gym where I was living,' she said.

'I was tired from working long days and I was falling out of my lifestyle routine. Eventually, very slowly, I noticed my weight started to come back on. 

'It wasn't a big hit but it slowly started to pile back on. I still had a love for food at the time so I started eating big meals again.'

Within three years, she gained 15kg.

But her weight spiralled out of control when she found comfort in food after relocating again for a new job opportunity at a gym.

'I had no friends or family, there was no community feel at the gym and I was extremely unhappy with my job,' she said.

'I suffer from bad anxiety so my anxiety was through the roof. I felt so isolated that I found myself finding happiness with food.'

Kristy explained how she felt she was binging on food because she was experiencing loneliness and isolation.

'I was scrolling through Uber Eats and it would take out an hour of my night - but it was taking my mind off the fact that I was feeling so lonely and isolated,' she said.

'Most of my nights were spent on ordering meals through the app - and I remember feeling happiness just from waiting for my order to arrive.

'At that stage, the damage had already started on my body.' 

Eventually, Kristy said she started battling 'demons in my head' and saw her weight pile back up to 96kg at the age of 27.

'The thoughts that were running through my head was not something a healthy person would have,' she said.

'They were toxic thoughts, and it continuously led me to hate myself. It was a viscous cycle. I was so depressed, I didn't leave the house or go out in public.

'I didn't want to go to work, my social anxiety was so bad, I was crying daily - I even lost friendships because I refused to leave the house.

'I would tell myself I was fat and ugly - and I didn't deserve to lose weight.'

Kristy's healthy day on a plate 

Breakfast: Toast and egg with avocado and spinach

Morning tea: Coffee 

Lunch: Protein shake with banana or yoghurt

Snack: Nuts 

Dinner: Youfoodz - healthy meals delivered to her doorstep

As her emotions took a toll on her life, Kristy said when she started suffering from excruciating pain, she could no longer exercise.

'My orthopaedic surgeon told me that the cartilage in my knee started to wear away because I was gaining so much weight,' she said.

'The only chance I had to stop the pain I was feeling from my knee, was to lose a lot of weight fast. I already knew with my mental state that taking all exercise out of the equation was going to ruin me.' 

And it wasn't until she met a woman at her gym, her life turned around for the better.

'I had one of the members signed up at the gym in September last year and she told me she just needed to tone up after losing 97kg,' she said.

'I asked her how she lost that much weight and she told she about undergoing gastric sleeve surgery and how she had half her stomach removed.'

So she started looking into the procedure and found she could access her superannuation on medical compassionate grounds to help with the cost of life-saving surgery.

'I was very lucky to get approval from my surgeon because I was suffering from my health and mental battle,' she said.

After undergoing the procedure in December last year, Kristy - who now weighs 74kg - said she feels happier about her life more than ever.

'I have never been so happy in my whole life,' she said. 

'Having the ability not to worry anymore is such an ease at mind. I was suffering from anxiety but now I feel so happy, and I'm always happy. 

'At the time of surgery, I was very secretive about it and I did feel ashamed because it's frowned upon by so many people because it's taking the easy road - but it's not.'

Since getting surgery, Kristy said she now eats every two hours up to six meals a day - but each portion is tiny.

She gets her meals ordered through a healthy delivery service called Youfoodz - and she would split the meals into two or three portions.

Kristy workouts four to five times a week - and takes her dog walking every morning. 

By sharing her story, Kristy - who went from a size 18-16 to size 10-eight - wanted others to draw hope from her experiences.

'I know there are a lot of people who can and can't relate. If you struggle every second day with your weight and food, then you should get surgery,' she said.

'I have been really blessed with no issues, I've had negative effects with surgery. I've had an awesome healing process and I can now eat any food I want.

'My advice is, if it's an option for you, you should go ahead with it. Now I'm not even slightly ashamed about the surgery. 

'I'm just so happy and my life has changed so drastically. I want to be able to help inspire people who suffer the same way to just do it.' 

For confidential support, please Lifeline Australia - 13 11 14.

item.title: Is this the secret to clearing up eczema for good? Bikini designer, 28, shares the $20 solution that has transformed her painful and inflamed skin
item.description: Port Macquarie-based bikini designer Karina Irby recently revealed how she has transformed her eczema-prone skin with a $20 product in just three weeks. So what's her secret?
item.content:encoded:
While in most circles Karina Irby is known as the body-positive creator and CEO of the Moana Bikini line, the 28-year-old has also gained fans because she is not afraid to talk about her struggle with eczema.

And now, the Port Macquarie native has come clean about how she has completely transformed her eczema-prone skin in just three weeks. 

Writing on her Instagram page, Karina explained how it took just $20 to clear up her eczema. So what's her secret?

According to the bikini designer, potassium permanganate crystals, which you can 'pick up from your local chemist for less than $20', could be the answer.

'I can't believe I'm even publicly posting this,' Karina posted, alongside a photograph of her legs before and after using the crystals. 

'This is a big deal for me and I even contemplated NOT sharing my three week eczema transformation out of pure embarrassment.'

However, in spite of her shame, the 28-year-old said she decided to because of her own experience as a teenager, 'struggling with my skin', without any help.

'I would have killed to have seen another human talking about eczema, so that's exactly what I'm going to do here,' she said.

What is potassium permanganate?

* Potassium permanganate is a common chemical compound that combines manganese oxide ore with potassium hydroxide.

* It was first developed as a disinfectant in 1857. Since then, it’s been widely used to treat a variety of skin conditions, including fungal infections.

* When applied to your skin, potassium permanganate kills germs by releasing oxygen when it meets compounds in your skin. It also acts as an astringent, which is a drying agent.

* Some of the conditions that it can help include infected eczema, open and blistering wounds and athlete's foot.

Source: Healthline 

Karina went on to say that she was 'recently educated by a clinical dermatologist' who told her that she had allowed her eczema to 'evolve into a chronic, severe condition'.

'I was pretty upset and shocked that I'd let that happen,' she said.

'Honestly, I was just uneducated and didn't know how to treat my skin properly.'

For the past three weeks, the bikini designer said that she has been soaking her legs for 10 minutes every morning and evening in potassium permanganate crystals.

She said that 'this apparently kills any bad infection in the skin that's keeping my eczema from healing properly'. 

Concluding her post, Karina wrote: 'I hope by me showing off my experience I can help shed a little light for others who after suffering.'

Since she shared the photograph on Instagram on Friday morning, the bikini designer has received a wave of support, with others saying they can't wait to try the crystals.

'Wow! That's a huge difference. And thank you for sharing your story. Two out of my three children have eczema and I'm always searching for and trying new things to ease their pain,' one mother posted.

'LOVE potassium permanganate for pompholyx eczema on my hands,' another added. 

'It does stain my skin a tan colour but love that you only need a tiny bit. Apple cider vinegar soak also helps a tonne.'
